events.title: British Army Surrenders at Saratoga
events.description: General John Burgoyne's British forces surrendered to American troops during the Revolutionary War, marking a turning point in the conflict.
events.significance: This victory convinced France to formally ally with the American colonies, aiding this pivotal moment in securing American independence.

events.title: Charles Dickens' 'A Christmas Carol' Published
events.description: The first edition of 'A Christmas Carol' was published, introducing characters like Ebenezer Scrooge to the public.
events.significance: The novella became a beloved holiday classic, significantly influencing how Christmas is celebrated and perceived culturally.

events.title: President Bill Clinton Admits to an Extramarital Affair
events.description: President Clinton publicly acknowledged his relationship with Monica Lewinsky during a televised address amid an ongoing investigation.
events.significance: This admission led to impeachment proceedings and remains a significant moment in U.S. political history regarding presidential ethics.

events.title: Apollo 17 Launches on the Last Manned Moon Mission
events.description: Apollo 17, the final mission of NASA's Apollo program, launched with astronauts Eugene Cernan, Ronald Evans, and Harrison Schmitt onboard.
events.significance: This mission marked the last time humans visited the moon, contributing valuable scientific data and demonstrating the heights of space exploration.
